GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles as objects

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an object of the specified article with key information

exampleResponse.title: Moustache

exampleResponse.body: Have you seen the size of that thing?

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of comment objects of the specified article

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: posts a new comment which is associated with the given article id and returns the comment body
POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.exampleResponse: this is a bunch of nonsense

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: updates a particular key on an article object (vote value) for a specific article and returns the entire updated object

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: deletes a comment from the database by its comment_id

GET /api/users.description: returns an array of all users in the database, which each user object containing key value user info

GET /api/users/:username.description: returns an object of the user who has been specified in the endpoint

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: returns an object of a specified comment where the votes have been updated

POST /api/articles.description: posts a new article to the database and returns the newly added article as an object with its key + value information

POST /api/topics.description: posts a new topic to the database and returns the newly added topic as an object with its key + value information

DELETE /api/articles/:article_id.description: deletes an article from the database, as well as the comments related to the article's id number
